definition: man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
Chinese wolfberry shrub (Lycium chinense)/willow
Qi, a Zhou Dynasty vassal state/surname Qi
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
to worry/to concern oneself with/worried/anxiety/sorrow/(literary) to observe mourning
day/sky/heaven

sentences.english: Fears of an invasion of "Polish plumbers" apparently turned out to be unfounded.
sentences.chinese: 對“波蘭水管工”湧入發達國家的憂慮可謂杞人憂天。

sentences.english: Maybe the large number of scientists who caution about impending catastrophes are worrywarts .
sentences.chinese: 也許這一大批發出警報的科學家只是杞人憂天。

sentences.english: Later, someone persuade him that his fears were groundless. This idioms satirizes those who worry unnecessary.
sentences.chinese: 成語杞人憂天譏笑那些沒有必要或毫無根據的憂慮。

sentences.english: I hate to admit it, but I'm a worrier.
sentences.chinese: 我不願意承認，但我確實常常杞人憂天。

sentences.english: Alarmists fear that South Korea—which has a much smaller population—may overtake Japan, too.
sentences.chinese: 杞人憂天者則害怕人口小國韓國也將超過日本。

sentences.english: I made that up, in the same way that alarmists have made up the threat levels.
sentences.chinese: 以上我是編造的，就像那些杞人憂天的傢伙一樣。

sentences.english: Were all those pandemic warnings just scare-mongering?
sentences.chinese: 那些流行病預警是杞人憂天嚇唬人的嗎？

sentences.english: Therefore, current fears of many employees of major United States corporations are not deemed to be a fike .
sentences.chinese: 因此，目前一些公司僱員的擔心不能說是杞人憂天的。

sentences.english: We too often borrow trouble, and  anticipate that may never appear.
sentences.chinese: 我們常常過多地自尋煩惱，杞人憂天。

sentences.english: Worrywarts need reassurance and encouragement to overcome their fears.
sentences.chinese: 杞人憂天的人需要安全感和鼓勵幫助他們克服恐懼。

sentences.english: Baby, " I'll tell her, "remember, your momma is a worrier.
sentences.chinese: 我會告訴她“寶貝兒，記住，你媽媽是個杞人憂天者。
